instructions: Backup Android Contacts to SD card Every smartphone will typically come with a default pre-installed app for Contacts . Usually, these Contacts app can backup your current contact list stored on the phone regardless if they are saved on the Phone s memory or the SIM. To backup contacts using the Contacts app, follow the steps below: Launch the Contacts app. Proceed to the app s Settings . Tap Export to storage and proceed with exporting the contacts. how_to_backup_contacts_to_sd_card Export to SD Card And that s it, you now have a complete backup of your contacts. You can import your contacts anytime as long as you have the memory card where you saved the backup installed. Note : Not all smartphones will have the backup option with the pre-installed Contacts app. This option is not available with most Samsung smartphones. Backup Contacts to Google Account Android smartphones usually come with Google settings within the general device settings. The Google settings will let you backup your contacts with your Google account which is a nice feature to have. Most especially if you are using Gmail as your main email address. To backup contacts with Google account, follow the steps below: Launch the Settings app. Navigate to Google services settings. Tap Backup and ensure that Contacts is selected. Tap Back up now to backup your contacts. Backup to Google Account Backup to Google Account And that s it. You now have a complete backup copy of your contacts tied with your Google account. For this method to work, make sure that you have an active Google account to use it with. Backup Contacts Using Built-In Device Backup & Restore Another way to backup your contacts is to use the built-in device backup & restore option. Follow the steps below to backup your contact using this method: Launch Settings app. Navigate to System options or Advance options. Navigate once again to Backup & Restore . Once found, tap on it. Tap Data backup and tap External storage . Select Memory card and tap Back up to begin contacts backup. Select System Select Backup & Restore Save to External Storage Once done, you now have a complete backup file of your contacts saved on your phones external micro SD card. You can also save your contacts either on an external OTG USB Flash Drive or on your computer s storage drive by selecting either of them. Backup Android Contacts with Third-Party Apps If there s an app that we can strongly recommend for backing up contacts, it s gonna be the Contacts app by Google LLC. contact_google_llc_app_backup_sync Contacts App by Google This app is designed not just to be an app that handles your phones contacts but it can also perform contact backups and sync them across all your devices. contact_google_llc_app_backup_sync Sync Across All Devices If you set this app as your default Contacts app, you will be able to back up your contacts and sync them across all your devices. Additionally, it can also back up the contacts in your Google Account to the cloud as well as enable you to have access to it in your Google Account from any device. This is by far what we consider the best method to backup your contacts if you are using an Android smartphone. To back up your contacts using the Contacts app by Google, all you have to do is: Download and install the app. Launch the app and tap the circular icon found at the top right corner of the app interface. (This is mostly your picture or an icon of a phone) Select Device and then tap Back up . (If you have more than one Google account associated with your phone, select the Google account that you prefer to move the contacts into) Wait for a couple of seconds and that s it. You now have successfully created a backup of your contacts and uploaded it to your Google account.
